hero.title: BEING CHURCH TOGETHER
hero.description: Jesus is holy, loving, and worthy of all our worship and devotion. You will feel heaven in our Grace Community Church. Join us and Praise the Lord Jesus.

welcome.title: Being Church
welcome.description: The Council of Protestant Churches of Cameroon (CEPCA) is an ecumenical organization representing 12 member churches, 13 million believers, and 15,500 congregations. We are united in our mission of healing, education, and holistic community development across Cameroon.

healthcare.title: Healthcare
healthcare.description: 350 hospitals and health centers providing quality care across Cameroon.

education.title: Education
education.description: 1,580 schools and 15 universities educating over 500,000 students annually.

spiritualLeadership.title: Spiritual Leadership
spiritualLeadership.description: Serving 13 million believers through 15,500 congregations nationwide.

missionVision.title: Mission & Vision
missionVision.subtitle: "Being Church Together" - United in purpose, diverse in expression

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description1: While we may differ from one another, it remains true that through the work of the Holy Spirit and respect for democratic principles, we can all speak a common language—the language of love.
vision.description2: CEPCA strengthens our shared sense of belonging as Churches united in defending a common cause. This is no longer a mere juxtaposition of denominations, but a true ecumenical institution committed to advancing Protestant interests—a vision of integration.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Our renewed mission focuses on healing, liberation, and the holistic development of the human person.

health.title: Health
health.description: Providing quality care and compassionate service, combating HIV/AIDS, malaria, tuberculosis, and improving community health.

education.title: Education
education.description: Continuing the legacy of Christian missions, training competent citizens who uphold Christian ethics wherever they serve.

pastoral.title: Pastoral Ministry
pastoral.description: Remaining a prophetic voice, standing beside those in distress and speaking through diverse media and worship contexts.

corePrinciples.title: Our Core Principles
corePrinciples.principle1: Confesses Jesus Christ as the only Lord and Savior
corePrinciples.principle2: Recognizes the Holy Scriptures as the sole standard of faith
corePrinciples.principle4: Works closely with member churches to achieve objectives

objectives.title: Our Objectives
objectives.subtitle: Working together to strengthen and unite Protestant churches across Cameroon

objectives.objective2: Develop and coordinate joint efforts in evangelism and Christian service
objectives.objective3: Promote Christian life through common social and economic projects

objectives.objective5: Represent Cameroonian Protestantism before public authorities
objectives.objective6: Express the 'Voice of Protestants' on matters of public and ethical concern

history.title: Our History
history.description: The wave of independence movements that disrupted the Evangelical Federation of French Equatorial Africa led to the creation of FEMEC in 1969, which later evolved into CEPCA.
history.preview: CEPCA was born from the need to coordinate Protestant Churches in Cameroon after independence. The first General Secretary, Rev. Eugène MALLO, coordinated activities through the Education and Health Committee.

missionVision.title: Mission & Vision
missionVision.description: Our mission focuses on healing, liberation, and holistic development. Our vision is integration through the language of love, uniting Churches in defending a common cause.
missionVision.preview: CEPCA strengthens our shared sense of belonging as Churches united. Through the Holy Spirit and democratic principles, we speak the common language of love.

departments.title: Departments
departments.description: CEPCA operates through specialized departments including Health, Education, Women and Social Affairs, Christian Witness, Youth, Information and Communication.
departments.preview: Our departments coordinate activities across member churches, from health services and education to youth programs and communication initiatives.

structure.title: CEPCA Structure
structure.description: Our organizational structure includes the General Assembly, Executive Committee, and specialized Commissions that ensure effective governance and coordination.
structure.preview: The General Assembly serves as our supreme decision-making body, meeting every two years to define overall policy and direction.
